title: HTML SEO Basics
subject: HTML
learning_objectives: Importance of Title and Meta Description
Image Alt text and headings ranking
theory:
# HTML SEO Basics

**SEO** (Search Engine Optimization) is the practice of increasing the quantity and quality of traffic to your website through organic search engine results.

HTML structure plays a vital role in SEO.

## 1. Page Title `<title>`
The most important SEO tag. It appears in the search result as the clickable headline.
*   Ideally 50-60 characters.
*   Should include main keywords.

## 2. Meta Description
Provides a summary of the page. search engines usually show this below the title.
*   Ideally 150-160 characters.

## 3. Headings (`<h1>`-`<h6>`)
Use headings to structure content. Google uses H1 to understand the main topic.
*   **Rule:** One `<h1>` per page.

## 4. Semantic Tags
Using `<article>`, `<main>`, `<aside>` helps bots determine what is primary content and what is ads/nav.

## 5. Alt Text
Search engines can only "see" images via their `alt` text. Optimizing this helps image search rankings.

## 6. URL Structure
Clean URLs (`/courses/html`) are better than parameter soup (`/page?id=523`).

examples.code:
<head>
  <title>Learn HTML5 - Free Course for Beginners</title>
  <meta name="description" content="Master HTML attributes, elements, and semantics with our free interactive tutorial.">
</head>
examples.explanation: This tells Google exactly what the page is about.

common_mistakes.correction: Every page on your site should have a unique Title tag.
Don't spam keywords in H1 or Alt text. Write for humans first.

interview_questions.question: What is on-page SEO?
interview_questions.answer: It refers to optimizing the content and HTML source code of a page (titles, meta, headings, alt text) to rank higher.

interview_questions.question: Why is only one <h1> recommended?
interview_questions.answer: The H1 represents the main topic of the document. Multiple H1s confuse search engines about the page's primary focus.

practice_problems.problem: Write an SEO-friendly title and description for a recipe page about 'Chocolate Cake'.
practice_problems.solution:
<title>Best Chocolate Cake Recipe - Easy & Moist</title>
<meta name="description" content="Bake the perfect moist chocolate cake with this easy step-by-step recipe. Ready in 45 minutes.">

real_world_use_cases.description: Product pages must have unique Titles (Product Name) and Alt text (Product details) to appear in Google Shopping results.

summary: Good HTML is good SEO. By writing semantic, structured code with proper titles, headings, and descriptions, you make it easy for search engines to understand and rank your content, bringing more users to your site.
